title: How to Make Loukoumades

steps.headline: Mix the flour, yeast, salt and sugar together in a large bowl, stirring  to combine and remove any lumps.
steps.description: Add the water and stir to make a smooth  thick batter. Put aside to prove for 45 to 60 minutes or until doubled in volume.

steps.headline: Meanwhile, prepare the syrup.
steps.description: Heat honey, lemon juice and rosewater together and bring to a gentle simmer. Add fruit and optional extras as desired and allow to cool. Ideally be selective with your optional extras, to ensure the flavours are compatible.

steps.headline: Heat oil to 170C / 330F in a deep saucepan.
steps.description: Ideally the oil level should be no higher than 2/3rds of the volume of the pan.

steps.headline: Spoon tablespoons of batter into the hot oil.
steps.description: Scoop the batter carefully  from the sides of the bowl to ensure maximum lightness. Do not overcrowd  the pan as they will expand. Keep turning the loukoumades to ensure they  brown evenly.

steps.headline: Cook 3-4 minutes or until puffed and golden.
steps.description: Remove with a slotted spoon  to drain on some paper towel. Keep them warm as you cook the next batch.

steps.headline: Serve warm with syrup and garnish with pistachios and sprinkled  cinnamon.
steps.description: Ideally 4 each is a decent serve, may also be served hot with  the syrup and vanilla bean ice cream.

text: Mix the flour, yeast, salt and sugar together in a large bowl, stirring  to combine and remove any lumps. Add the water and stir to make a smooth  thick batter. Put aside to prove for 45 to 60 minutes or until doubled in volume. Meanwhile, prepare the syrup. Heat honey, lemon juice and rosewater together and bring to a gentle simmer. Add fruit and optional extras as desired and allow to cool. Ideally be selective with your optional extras, to ensure the flavours are compatible. Heat oil to 170C / 330F in a deep saucepan. Ideally the oil level should be no higher than 2/3rds of the volume of the pan. Spoon tablespoons of batter into the hot oil. Scoop the batter carefully  from the sides of the bowl to ensure maximum lightness. Do not overcrowd  the pan as they will expand. Keep turning the loukoumades to ensure they  brown evenly. Cook 3-4 minutes or until puffed and golden. Remove with a slotted spoon  to drain on some paper towel. Keep them warm as you cook the next batch. Serve warm with syrup and garnish with pistachios and sprinkled  cinnamon. Ideally 4 each is a decent serve, may also be served hot with  the syrup and vanilla bean ice cream.
